src.model.gameobjects package¶

Submodules¶

src.model.gameobjects.entity module¶

Class definition for the Entity and Player objects.

The Entity class is the parent class of the Player and Enemy classes, and any other object on the canvas.

Usage:

test_entity = Entity((20, 20), 30, 30, True) object_can_collide = test_entity.isColliding()

class src.model.gameobjects.entity.Block(xPos: int, yPos: int, width: int, height: int)¶

Bases: Entity

An entity platform that sprites can stand on.

coordinates¶

The object’s position on the tilemap.

width¶

The width of the object.

height¶

The height of the object.

x¶

the x co-ordenate of the entity on the game plane that will be displayed on the screen

y¶

the y co-ordenate of the entity on the game plane that will be displayed on the screen.

class src.model.gameobjects.entity.Door(xPos: int, yPos: int, width: int, height: int)¶

Bases: Block

An entity that sends you to a different level on contact.

check_for_entry(player) → bool¶

Checks if the door has been entered.

Returns: True if entered false if not

the enemy sprites that travel around the game deal damage to our innocent explorer inheretes from Monke Atributes:

dammage: the amount of dammage that this enemy deal.

class src.model.gameobjects.entity.InvincibilityLoot(xPos: int, yPos: int, width: int, height: int, power=2, time=1000)¶

Bases: Loot

loot that renders the player unable to be damaged by enemies for a particular period.

Atributes:
power_up_time: the time period remaining thatyou will be unable to

take dammage in.

Bases: Loot

loot that makes you jump higher.

Atributes:

jump_increase: the amoun that your jump height increases when you get the loot power_up_time: the time period that your increased jump height remains in place

class src.model.gameobjects.entity.Monke(xPos: int, yPos: int, width: int, height: int, colliding: bool, speed: int)¶

Bases: Entity

a class that represents a Monke like entity on the screen. inherets from entity

check_no_hit(blocks: list[src.model.gameobjects.entity.Entity]) → None¶

checks if the Monke has hit the top of the block or the ground.

Parameters:

blocks – a list of blocks of type Block

Returns: True If you have not hit the top of the block or the ground.

collideTop(entities: list[src.model.gameobjects.entity.Entity]) → bool¶

collideTop is an internal method that checks if the Monke is on top of a block.

Parameters:

  • blocks – a list of block objects representing the block platforms on the screen

  • on. (that can be stood) –

Returns: True if the Monke is standing on a platform and False if not.

gravity(entities: list[src.model.gameobjects.entity.Entity]) → bool¶

if a monke let go of tree it falls.

Bases: Block

An entity that shows you an inscription when interacted with.

check_for_read(player) → bool¶

Checks if the monolith is being read.

class src.model.gameobjects.entity.Player(width: int, height: int, SCREEN_WIDTH: int, SCREEN_HEIGHT: int)¶

Bases: Monke

Player is the class that is used to represent the main charicter in the game.

this class stores the information about the player that is independent from the game engine implementation.

this class inheretes from entity as it is an entity on a screen.

screen_width¶

the width of the game screen that is being used

screen height

the height of the screen being used

facing¶

the direction that the charicter is going in used for deciding which sprite to display in the view

_player¶

how fast the player moves on the screen

x¶

the x co-ordenate of the player on the game plane that will be displayed on the screen

y¶

the y co-ordenate of the player on the game plane that will be displayed on the screen.

health¶

a number 1-10 representing the health of the player.

score¶

the score of the player that represents the final score that will be used in the final leaderbord.

isInvincable¶

True if the player cannot take dammage at this moment in time

calculate_collition_results(entities, enemies, directions)¶
get_health()¶
get_invincibility()¶
get_score()¶
property health¶
property isInvincable¶
move(directions: list[src.model.gameobjects.public_enums.Movement], entities: list[src.model.gameobjects.entity.Entity], enemies) → None¶

this method is called to change the state of the player.

this method is called to change the state of the player and does not have to be in response to a movement. (no movement is an option)

Parameters:

direction – direction of type Movement(enum) that indicates the direction the player is to move.

property score¶
update_loot_stats()¶

stores whether the player has gained any special powers.

creates a timer and decrements it each frame to store the time that the powers will run out.
